Package org.jlab.icalibrate.epics

Class ChannelManager

java.lang.Object
org.jlab.icalibrate.epics.ChannelManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class ChannelManager extends Object implements Closeable
Responsible for managing EPICS Channel Access.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public DBR get(String pv) throws CAException, TimeoutException
      Perform a synchronous (blocking) CA-GET request of the given PV.
      Parameters:
      pv - The EPICS CA PV name
      Returns:
      The EPICS DataBaseRecord
      Throws:
      CAException - If unable to perform the CA-GET due to IO
      TimeoutException - If unable to perform the CA-GET in a timely fashion

    • put

      public void put(String pv, String value) throws CAException, TimeoutException
      Perform a synchronous (blocking) CA-PUT request of the given PV and value.
      Parameters:
      pv - The EPICS CA PV name
      value - The String value
      Throws:
      CAException - If unable to perform the CA-GET due to IO
      TimeoutException - If unable to perform the CA-GET in a timely fashion

    • put

      Perform a synchronous (blocking) CA-PUT request of the given PV and value.
      Parameters:
      pv - The EPICS CA PV name
      value - The Number value
      Throws:
      CAException - If unable to perform the CA-GET due to IO
      TimeoutException - If unable to perform the CA-GET in a timely fashion

    • addPv

      public void addPv(PvListener listener, String pv)
      Registers a PV monitor on the supplied PV for the given listener. Equivalent to calling addPvs with a set of one PV.
      Parameters:
      listener - The PvListener
      pv - The EPICS PV name

    • addPvs

      public void addPvs(PvListener listener, Set<String> addPvSet)
      Registers PV monitors on the supplied PVs for the given listener. Note that internally only a single monitor is used for any given PV. PVs for which the given listener is already listening to are skipped (duplicate PVs are ignored). There is no need to call addListener before calling this method.
      Parameters:
      listener - The PvListener to receive notifications
      addPvSet - The set of PVs to monitor

    • clearPvs

      public void clearPvs(PvListener listener, Set<String> clearPvSet)
      Removes the supplied PVs from the given listener.
      Parameters:
      listener - The PvListener
      clearPvSet - The PV set to clear

    • addListener

      public void addListener(PvListener listener)
      A convenience method to add a listener without registering any PVs to monitor. This is a rare use-case and is equivalent to calling addPvs with a null set of PVs.

      Allowing a listener without any PVs registered may be deprecated in the future.

      Parameters:
      listener - The PvListener

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener(PvListener listener)
      Removes the specified listener and unregisters any PVs the listener was interested in.
      Parameters:
      listener - The PvListener

    • getPvToCountMap

      public Map<String,Integer> getPvToCountMap()
      Returns a map of PVs to count of listeners for informational purposes.
      Returns:
      The PV to monitor map

    • getListenerToPvsMap

      public Map<PvListener,Set<String>> getListenerToPvsMap()
      Returns an unmodifiable map of listeners to their PVs for informational purposes.
      Returns:
      The listener to PVs map

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Cleans up the EPICS CA plumbing.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Throws:
      IOException - If unable to close
